comments.body: It looks like `bulkDocs` takes an `Array<Core.PutOptions>` (compare [`put` documentation](https://pouchdb.com/api.html#create_document) to [`bulkDocs` documentation](https://pouchdb.com/api.html#batch_create)).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +270,274 @@
        bulkDocs(docs: Core.Document<Content>[],
                 options: Core.PutOptions | void,
                 callback: Core.Callback<Core.Error, Core.Response[]>): void;
        bulkDocs(docs: Core.Document<Content>[],

comments.body: Same as above, I think this should be `Array<Core.PutOptions>`.

Thanks. Actually, I can't find where it's said that it's an array.
I was on pouchdb slack and I had the confirmation from someone that it's just an object.
In addition, this is some go implementation:
[Go implementation of pouchdb](https://godoc.org/github.com/flimzy/go-pouchdb#PouchDB.BulkDocs)
Oh, you're absolutely right.  I misread your type definitions (I was looking at the wrong parameter).   Looks good to me.
